page.title: 19WATCHFIELD SCHOOL
page.content: Watchfield Village,in the County of Oxfordshire,has existed from early times.Indeed,the 'Manor'of Watchfield (or Wachenesfeld as it was then known) belonged to the Abbot and Convent of Abingdon as early as the time of King Kenulf(an ally of King Alfred)in the 9th century. The village was enclosed,by an Act of Parliament,passed in 1789,when allotments of land were assigned to Lord Radnor and the Church. A school has existed in the village since 1883.The first school was closed in 1913;the children of the village then attended Shrivenham School. In 1963 a new school was in Watchfield. The buildings as we know them today were finally completed in 1967.
